intro: Pyrethrum roopianum, commonly known as the African pyrethrum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant produces fine, hair-like structures called trichomes, which contain pyrethrins—natural insecticides. Pyrethrum roopianum thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its botanical features make it both aesthetically pleasing and ecologically valuable.
